intro: Distephanus populifolius, commonly known as the "poplar-leaved daisy," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are broad and resemble those of poplar trees, giving it its common name. Distephanus populifolius is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
